author: Rindala Alajaji
description: If you’ve been following the wave of age-gating laws sweeping across the country and the globe, you’ve probably noticed that lawmakers, tech companies, and advocates all seem to be using different terms for what sounds like the same thing. Age verification, age assurance, age estimation, age gating—they get thrown around interchangeably, but they technically mean different things. And those differences […]
title: Age Verification, Estimation, Assurance, Oh My! A Guide To The Terminology

author: Karl Bode
description: CNN, like most U.S. cable news networks, professes to provide users access to journalism. Instead, what you’ll most consistently find is a sort of generic, ad-slathered, center-right, corporatist drivel with the rough edges (read: truth) sanded off like a Ken doll’s genitals to avoid offense. “View from nowhere” journalism that doesn’t inform so much as […]
title: CNN’s Latest Innovation: Slathering Your Screen With T-Mobile Ads

author: Mike Masnick
description: Last week’s dismissal of the FTC’s antitrust case against Meta—combined with the earlier limited remedies in the Google search case—demonstrates something that should be obvious by now: antitrust is a pathetically weak tool for increasing competition in digital markets. This isn’t an argument against competition. Competition in digital markets matters, desperately. But antitrust enforcement is […]
title: If Your Antitrust Case Depends On Pretending TikTok Doesn’t Exist, It’s Going To Fail

author: Tim Cushing
description: Border Patrol commander Gregory Bovino has already made a name for himself during Trump’s second administration. He began making this name by engaging in an unapproved sweep of the area he controlled in California as Trump was still waiting to be sworn in. Then he was sent to Chicago by a vengeful Trump who wanted […]
title: Federal Judge Spends Most Of 233 Pages Calling Out DHS, ICE, CBP, Border Patrol For Their Lies

author: Daily Deal
description: Dive into the world of self-driving cars, speech recognition technology, and more with the Complete Machine Learning Bundle. Over 10 courses, you will learn about pattern recognition and prediction, and how to harness the power of machine learning to take your programming to the next level. Discover quant trading, how to harness large data sets, […]
title: Daily Deal: The Complete Machine Learning Bundle

author: Mike Masnick
description: For the last few years, Matt Taibbi, Michael Shellenberger, and their allies have spent considerable energy attacking both academic researchers studying disinformation and the trust & safety teams at social media platforms working to identify and remove coordinated inauthentic behavior—particularly foreign influence operations. They’ve insisted that any attempt to study and limit such operations is […]
title: X’s New Feature Reveals Why Trust & Safety Work Was Never About The ‘Censorship Industrial Complex’

author: Karl Bode
description: Now that streaming subscriber growth has slowed, we’ve noted repeatedly how the streaming TV sector is falling into all of the bad habits that ultimately doomed traditional cable TV. That has involved chasing pointless “growth for growth’s sake” megamergers, imposing bottomless price hikes and new annoying restrictions on customers, undermining labor, and cutting corners on product quality in […]
title: Enshittification Ahoy: Streaming Video Price Hikes Show No Sign Of Slowing Down
